about.name: Las Vegas
about.info_text: Las Vegas, often referred to as the 'Entertainment Capital of the World,' is a vibrant city located in the Mojave Desert of Nevada, USA. Known for its world-famous casinos, extravagant hotels, and dazzling nightlife, Las Vegas is a destination for those seeking excitement and entertainment. Beyond the iconic Las Vegas Strip, the city offers a wide range of activities, from shopping and dining to outdoor adventures and cultural experiences.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 650,000
State: Nevada
Time Zone: Pacific Time Zone (UTC-08:00)
Language: English
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Las Vegas experiences a desert climate with hot summers and mild winters. Summers are extremely hot with temperatures often exceeding 100°F (37°C), while winters are mild and comfortable for outdoor activities.

attractions_card.title: Las Vegas Strip
attractions_card.description: The Las Vegas Strip is a world-renowned boulevard known for its iconic resorts, hotels, and casinos. It's a hub of entertainment, fine dining, and nightlife.

attractions_card.title: Bellagio Fountains
attractions_card.description: The Bellagio Fountains are a mesmerizing water show in front of the Bellagio Hotel, featuring choreographed water jets that dance to music and lights.

attractions_card.title: Fremont Street Experience
attractions_card.description: Fremont Street is known for its dazzling light canopy, live entertainment, and a vibrant atmosphere that includes street performers and outdoor concerts.

attractions_card.alt: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area
attractions_card.title: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area
attractions_card.description: Red Rock Canyon is a stunning natural attraction offering hiking, rock climbing, and scenic drives amidst unique red rock formations.

attractions_card.title: Hoover Dam
attractions_card.description: The Hoover Dam is a marvel of modern engineering, providing tours and a glimpse into the history of this massive concrete arch-gravity dam.

attractions_card.title: Neon Boneyard
attractions_card.description: The Neon Boneyard is a museum of vintage neon signs, offering a nostalgic look at Las Vegas's history through its iconic signage.

attractions_card.title: High Roller
attractions_card.description: The High Roller is a giant observation wheel offering breathtaking views of the Las Vegas Strip and the surrounding desert landscape.

attractions_card.title: The Mob Museum
attractions_card.description: The Mob Museum delves into the history of organized crime in America and features interactive exhibits and artifacts.

food_card.title: Buffets
food_card.description: Las Vegas is famous for its all-you-can-eat buffets, offering a wide range of cuisines and culinary delights.

food_card.title: Steakhouses
food_card.description: Las Vegas boasts numerous high-end steakhouses known for their prime cuts and fine dining experiences.

food_card.title: International Cuisine
food_card.description: The city offers a diverse culinary scene, with international cuisine options from around the world.

food_card.title: Food Trucks
food_card.description: Food trucks in Las Vegas serve a variety of delicious street food, from tacos to gourmet burgers.

food_card.title: Casino Restaurants
food_card.description: Many casinos have upscale restaurants run by renowned chefs, providing an exquisite dining experience.

hotels_card.title: The Venetian Resort
hotels_card.description: The Venetian is a luxurious resort known for its Venetian-inspired architecture, spacious suites, and a replica of Venice's Grand Canal.

hotels_card.title: MGM Grand Hotel and Casino
hotels_card.description: The MGM Grand is one of the largest hotels in the world, featuring a casino, entertainment, and numerous dining options, including celebrity chef restaurants.

hotels_card.title: Wynn Las Vegas
hotels_card.description: Wynn Las Vegas is a luxury resort known for its elegant accommodations, fine dining, and a beautiful golf course.

hotels_card.title: Caesars Palace
hotels_card.description: Caesars Palace is an iconic hotel and casino with a Roman-inspired theme, offering world-class entertainment and dining.

transport_card.title: McCarran International Airport
transport_card.description: McCarran International Airport is the primary airport serving Las Vegas, providing domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Las Vegas Monorail
transport_card.description: The Las Vegas Monorail offers a convenient and efficient way to travel along the Las Vegas Strip, with stops at major resorts and attractions.

transport_card.title: RTC Transit
transport_card.description: RTC Transit operates public bus services in Las Vegas, connecting the Strip to downtown and other parts of the city.

transport_card.title: Taxis and Ridesharing
transport_card.description: Taxis and ridesharing services like Uber and Lyft are readily available for convenient transportation within the city.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rental agencies are accessible, allowing visitors to explore the Las Vegas area and nearby attractions at their own pace.
